notes: 電機大三合開；計網電腦教室

description.zh: 本課程目標為提升學生英文之閱讀能力與聽力。包含增加英文單字數量，科技論文文法、句型、結構等特質，及訓練聽力習慣。
description.en: This course aims to leverage up the ability of English reading and listening for students. It includes vocabulary amount increasing, grammar recognition, sentence style and organization, and listening comprehension.

name.en: Writing and presentation in the Technical Field

description.zh:
1. 工程寫作的基本技巧
 工程寫作結構、段落、圖表的製作
 國際單位與標點符號
2. 升學與求職之寫作
 簡歷表、自傳與讀書計畫、推薦信
 碩士推甄注意事項
3. 論文與職場之寫作
 論文寫作項目與格式、參考文獻
 備忘錄、會議記錄、產品說明書之寫法
4. 口語表達之藝術
 簡報、投影片製作
 簡報面談注意事項
5. 科技人的人文寫作
description.en:
1. Basic Writing Techniques
 Structures, paragraph, tables and graphics in the technical writing
 Engineering units and punctuations
2. Writing for Application of Schools or Finding Jobs
 Writing of resume, autobiography, letter of recommendation and study plan
 Tips on application to graduate schools
3. Thesis and Work Writing
 Items and format of a thesis
 Writing of references, memo and minutes of meeting
4. Oral Presentation
 Making of films by PowerPoint
 Tips on interviewing skills
5. Literature Writing by Technical Person

name.en: Principles and Practices of Parallel Programming

description.zh:
1.  平行概論 
2.  GPU平行計算技術
3.  GPU-CUDA介面 
4.  基礎CUDA程式撰寫 
5.  GPU-CUDA硬體規劃 
6.  進階CUDA程式撰寫
7.   GPU-CUDA最佳化 
8.   GPU-CUDA應用範例練習
description.en:
1.  Introduction to the principles of parallel programming
2.  Introduction to GPU computing 
3.  GPU-CUDA interfaces 
4.  GPU programming using CUDA
5.  Introduction to the hardware of GPU-CUDA 
6.  Advanced CUDA Programming 
7.  Optimization of GPU-CUDA programming 
8.  GPU-CUDA application practices

description.zh: 本課程包含3小時的LCD設計概論與3小時的製程概論，期望能讓同學在最短的時間內對LCD 的運作原理有初步的認識，並至工廠見習。
description.en: The course includes 3 hours LCD design introduction and 3 hours LCD process introduction to make students have the basic knowledge about the LCD operation and theory. Students can practice at the factory.

notes: (最後一哩)注意：課程有時彈性調為整天或整個下午上課

name.en: Examination Guidelines for Patent and Utility Model (II)

description.zh: 本課程下學期亦以智慧財產局頒布之「專利審查基準」為藍本，先介紹專利申請之特殊分割程序與改請程序，再就專利申請之「實體審查」部分依序說明先申請原則、發明單一性、優先權、說明書及圖式之補充與修正、更正、以及分割改請。
description.en: This course will be based on the "Patent Examination Guidelines" issued by the Taiwan Intellectual Property Office, and introduces the special procedure for patent division application and patent conversion application according to the principle of "formality before substantive examination". Then, in the "substantive examination" section, topics such as the first-to-file rule, unity of invention, the priority of a patent application, amendments of description, claims and drawings,  division of a patent and conversion of a patent will be sequentially discussed.

notes: 億光1035, 光電四、光電所與智財所合開

description.zh: 課程重點：(1)藉由適合其程度的教材加強學生必備的基礎文法觀念和句型結構；(2)使學生確切把握閱讀要領以及充分瞭解寫作的各種技巧，重心在生字、片語、句法的解釋和基本寫作技巧的分析；(3)熟悉英語人士日常生活情境及與學生將來就業環境相關之會話及適當之應對方式；(4)透過練習加強聽、說、讀、寫的知能及表達。
description.en: This course is designed (1) to strengthen students' previously required knowledge in English with basic grammatical ideas and sentence patterns reviewed through reading materials appropriate to their levels; (2) to develop reading skill by giving explanation of difficult words, phrases, and syntax, as well as analysis of basic writing skill; (3)to  familiarize students with useful expressions in conversation and build up their confidence in cross-cultural communication; (4)to reinforce the competence and performance of listening, speaking, reading and writing by practice.

description.zh: 本課程藉由不同情境之英語錄影帶, 以及專題的語彙題目來提供一個英語談話的情境使學生能學習合宜的詞句。小組討論、角色演練、口頭報告皆為主要教學技巧，俾能增強學生之聽說能力。
description.en: This course aims at providing an English-speaking environment to allow students learn about the speaking strategies and common expressions used in different situations through viewing video films and oral practice. Small-group/pair discussion and role-playing are also parts of the methodologies.

description.zh: 本課程藉由不同情境之英語錄影帶, 以及專題的語彙題目來提供一個英語談話的情境使學生能學習合宜的詞句。小組討論、角色演練、口頭報告皆為主要教學技巧，俾能增強學生之聽說能力。
description.en: This course aims at providing an English-speaking environment to allow students learn about the speaking strategies and common expressions used in different situations through viewing video films and oral practice. Small-group/pair discussion and role-playing are also parts of the methodologies.

description.zh: 本課程旨在幫助學生熟稔運用基本重要文法以寫出正確自然, 表達清晰之句子.  內容包括語法結構和錯誤分析, 例如不完整句、誤置修飾語、不連結修飾語、散漫句、錯誤平行結構、易混淆字、贅詞等常見問題。
description.en: This course is intended to provide a review of essential grammar skills as a background for students to construct sentences that convey ideas effectively and clearly.  The main content includes the correction of sentence fragments, run-on sentences, misplaced modifiers, dangling modifiers, and faulty parallelism.  Further focus is placed on varying syntactical structure, and on avoiding errors related to commonly confused words, slang, pretentious wording, cliches, and wordiness.

description.zh: 本課程旨在幫助學生熟稔運用基本重要文法以寫出正確自然, 表達清晰之句子.  內容包括語法結構和錯誤分析, 例如不完整句、誤置修飾語、不連結修飾語、散漫句、錯誤平行結構、易混淆字、贅詞等常見問題。
description.en: This course is intended to provide a review of essential grammar skills as a background for students to construct sentences that convey ideas effectively and clearly.  The main content includes the correction of sentence fragments, run-on sentences, misplaced modifiers, dangling modifiers, and faulty parallelism.  Further focus is placed on varying syntactical structure, and on avoiding errors related to commonly confused words, slang, pretentious wording, cliches, and wordiness.

description.zh: 本課程旨在介紹英語全球化、不同種類英語的出現，以及英語作為通用語言之發展、相關概念與論述。經由閱讀與課堂討論，學生將有機會檢視與英語全球化和全球英語相關的重要議題。
description.en: This course aims to provide students with an overview of the spread of the English language around the world, the emergence of English varieties, and the development of the popularization of English as a lingua franca. Through readings and class discussion, students will have the opportunity to examine key issues arising from the spread of English as well as the development of Global Englishes.

name.zh: 全球議題與趨勢討論(二)
name.en: Discussions on Global Issues and Trends II

description.zh: 本課程欲讓應用英文系學生了解改變社會結構之全球議題與趨勢。特此希望學生在參與討論的過程中，能夠產出對世界有正面效益之改善之道。課堂限制之關係，課程內容將著重於閱讀、答辯，和研討篩選後之報告及新聞，藉以達到上述之目的。
description.en: This course aims to engage English major students in understanding current issues and events taking place in the world that are redefining our global reality and restructuring the world order. A greater goal of such studies of global issues and activities is to urge students to participate in the dialogues and actions to change and to make better of the world.  The course content centers on reading, discussing and debating on selected reports and news to uphold all that matters for the aforementioned pursuits.

description.zh: 你熱愛文學嗎?你對社會及社會影響世界的方式好不好奇?你想不想探索社會政治事件表面背後的意涵?你喜不喜愛語言? 你是否會對許多故事的力量和神奇之處著迷?如果你的答案是否定的，透過這門課程，你會發現文學提供了既有價值又發人深省的社會觀點。反之，如果你熱愛文學，並且早已深受文學語言的吸引，你在這門課程裡將可從文學間接獲取豐富的生活經驗，進而學會如何理解世界。具體而言，藉由探索文學和社會的互動關係，透過研究社會如何促成文學的產生、賦之予脈絡，並加以型塑，以及文學如何反映、影響、塑造、及改變社會，你將會瞭解文學及語言的力量，更重要的是能在所處之世界裡變得安然自在。我們可能研讀的作品包括，但不限於，Things Fall Apart, Anthills of the Savannah, Uncle Tom’s Cabin, 1984, Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close等書。
description.en: Do you have a passion for literature? Are you curious about society and the way it influences the world around us? Would you like to explore the facade of sociopolitical events? Do you love language and are you fascinated by the power and magic of stories? If not, you will nevertheless learn in this course that literature provides a valuable and inspiring perspective on society. On the other hand, if you have already had a strong passion for literature and if you are already fascinated by literary language, you will learn in this course how to make sense of your world by enriching your vicarious experiences of it through literature. Specifically, by exploring the interaction between literature and society, by studying not only how society gives rise to, contextualizes, and molds literature, but also how literature mirrors, influences, shapes, and changes society, you will realize the power of literature and language and, more importantly, become at home in the world. The texts we will

description.zh: 本課程旨在進一步加強學生的口語表達溝通之能力。經由合宜的活動設計，如小組討論，與英語談話情境的塑造，如面談，學生將獲得充分機會以演練聽講的技巧。
description.en: This course is designed to develop oral communication skills at a higher level.  Stimulating themes and authentic content will be used to engage students and generate lively conversation, such as though-provoking newspaper, magazine articles, and video films. Activities include task-based pair and small-group discussion for maximum practice and personalization.

description.zh: 本課程旨在進一步加強學生的口語表達溝通之能力。經由合宜的活動設計，如小組討論，與英語談話情境的塑造，如面談，學生將獲得充分機會以演練聽講的技巧。
description.en: This course is designed to develop oral communication skills at a higher level.  Stimulating themes and authentic content will be used to engage students and generate lively conversation, such as though-provoking newspaper, magazine articles, and video films. Activities include task-based pair and small-group discussion for maximum practice and personalization.

description.zh: 本課程幫助學生習得敘述、描寫、推論、議論、省思、說明等文體方面的寫作技巧，並指導學生從閱讀、圖片、日常生活事件，及課堂討論內容中取材，以加強邏輯思考和流暢寫作能力。
description.en: This course aims to develop and reinforce students' strengths to create unified and coherent pieces of composition in a variety of styles--narrative, descriptive,  argumentative, reflective, and expository.  Students will be guided to write in response to readings, pictures, events in their daily lives, and discussions from the class.  Thought-provoking topics dealing with current issues are used to stimulate and foster critical writing strategies. This course enables students to write and discuss logically and clearly; they also need to incorporate grammatically newly-built vocabulary into their writing.

description.zh: 本課程幫助學生習得敘述、描寫、推論、議論、省思、說明等文體方面的寫作技巧，並指導學生從閱讀、圖片、日常生活事件，及課堂討論內容中取材，以加強邏輯思考和流暢寫作能力。
description.en: This course aims to develop and reinforce students' strengths to create unified and coherent pieces of composition in a variety of styles--narrative, descriptive,  argumentative, reflective, and expository.  Students will be guided to write in response to readings, pictures, events in their daily lives, and discussions from the class.  Thought-provoking topics dealing with current issues are used to stimulate and foster critical writing strategies. This course enables students to write and discuss logically and clearly; they also need to incorporate grammatically newly-built vocabulary into their writing.

description.zh: 本課程主要提供學生新聞報導寫作的原則及技巧指導。在課程中將針對新聞寫作的專題，社論及一般性報導技巧將逐一介紹，也包含最基本的新聞構成元素，新聞報導要點，和新聞寫作結構。參加本課程的學生，寫作，編輯和輸出都需有經驗並必須與學校新聞小組人員密切合作，讓教學延伸至課堂外。
description.en: This course aims to provide students with the skills and principles of news reporting and news writing. Types of journalistic writings will be introduced, including feature, editorial and story.  It also covers basic components of news, reporting principles, and news writing structure. Students enrolled in this course are required to work closely with the campus news publication staff, which allows students to expand the learning beyond classroom, with additional experience in writing, editing, and print production.

description.zh: 本課程主要在培養進階寫作能力，採用功能導向的方式，諸如書函，文章／書本摘要，評論，創作，學術專技報告等專項進行演練。
description.en: This course, using a functionally-oriented approach, aims at increasing university-level EFL writing students' English writing skills and developing them into more fluent, confident writers. To achieve this goal, students in this course will have ample opportunities to compose a wide variety of extended writing pieces, including letters, memos, abstracts, reviews, creative writings, and technical reports.

description.zh: 本課程主要在培養進階寫作能力，採用功能導向的方式，諸如書函，文章／書本摘要，評論，創作，學術專技報告等專項進行演練。
description.en: This course, using a functionally-oriented approach, aims at increasing university-level EFL writing students' English writing skills and developing them into more fluent, confident writers. To achieve this goal, students in this course will have ample opportunities to compose a wide variety of extended writing pieces, including letters, memos, abstracts, reviews, creative writings, and technical reports.

description.zh: 以對流行事物，如電影，音樂，廣告，服裝，電視，通俗小說等，在當代文化思潮中的影響，及其所扮演角色探討為經，並對於英語在各範疇中展現之語彙，修辭，語法，技巧之賞析為緯，引領學生進入一個交織著現代語文與現代意涵的世界。
description.en: This course aims at giving an approach to the study of television, popular music, popular literature such as magazines and best sellers, fashion and movies, as well as an examination into the influence of all aspects of our daily lives on our basic beliefs and values. It involves the use of methodologies from both the humanities and the social sciences in the effort to interpret expressive cultural forms. Students are encouraged to participate in discussion over selected topics from contemporary issues.

description.zh:
本課程討論主題為科學、技術、產業方面的科技英文。在課堂上我們將以各種類型的題材，包括科技新聞、科普文章、產業報導、學術論文和專利文獻等教材，在這個過程中，學生將學習各種類型科技英文是如何架構的，包括選題、文獻回顧、內容描述與評價。課程將著重於實際理解、寫作與簡報，而不是語言學。
課程內容將包含聽力練習、文章閱讀和討論；討論部分將訓練同學整理重點、英文簡報、商業應用文寫作的技巧，透過小組討論、報告和個人提交作業來提高每個學生在科技英文的全方位技能。
description.en:
The topics discussed in this course are English in the field of science, technology and industry. In the class, various types of teaching materials, such as science news, popular science articles, industry reports, academic papers and patent documents will be used. Students will learn how to structure talking, writing or presentation for technical English, including topic selection, literature review, description and evaluation. We will focus on practical understanding, writing and presentation rather than linguistics.
Listening exercises, reading and discussion will be practiced in the class.  Students will be trained to summarize science articles, have an attractive presentation, and practice business writing skills. The aim of the class is to improve overall skills of the students in technical English.

description.zh: 翻譯各式文體風格之文章，賞析名家之譯作，涵括文學、科學、教育、商業等領域作品，並佐以特殊表現法及修辭法之認識及練習。
description.en: This course aims at an appreciation of various styles of translated works in such fields as literature, education, science & technology, commerce. so as to equip students with a deep insight into the usage of rhetoric and expression for particular purpose.

description.zh: 翻譯各式文體風格之文章，賞析名家之譯作，涵括文學、科學、教育、商業等領域作品，並佐以特殊表現法及修辭法之認識及練習。
description.en: This course aims at an appreciation of various styles of translated works in such fields as literature, education, science & technology, commerce. so as to equip students with a deep insight into the usage of rhetoric and expression for particular purpose.

description.zh: 本課程以逐步口譯為主﹐深入模擬商務訪談﹐會議溝通﹐外賓接待至國際會議主持﹐隨行口譯﹐各式談判之概論與實例解說。課程注重模擬﹐演練及禮儀文化的涵養，以期訓練學生語言應對的能力及良好風度的表現。
description.en: This course focuses on Consecutive Interpretation. It simulates a commercial meeting and communication, visitors reception, international conference hosting and escort interpretation. In addition, it includes a general theory of different negotiations and examples. The course concentrates on simulation, practicum and courtesy cultivation. We expect to build up students' dialogue ability and manners.

name.en: Skills and Practicum of Escorting English

description.zh: 本課程提供在各種場合中口譯的應用。如伴隨工廠參觀，出席展覽會場，開幕演說，及外賓接待，採取密集的口語演練，並訓練隨行解說的技巧。
description.en: This course provides an application of Interpretation for different occasions. These situations include a factory visit, an exhibition presentation, an opening address, a foreign-visitors reception and a banquet attendance. This course aims to build up the techniques and cultivation of Escort Interpretation through intensive oral training.

description.zh: 教導學生認識色彩之成因及視覺現象.色彩系統之認識及色彩心理之種種現象.
description.en: Advanced understanding on color theories and color studies. Cognitive effect and emotional aspect of colors. Discussion on color scheme and color harmonies.

description.zh: 本課程主要針對各種材料（金屬、陶瓷、高分子、複合材料）之基本原 理，性質及應用，做概要性的介紹。內容包括材料之晶體結構與晶體缺 陷，固體材料之原子擴散，相圖與相變化，材料製程及應用，材料之物 理性質（光性質、電性質、磁性質及熱性質），材料之機械性質（強度 、延展性、硬度、韌性、疲勞、潛變），材料之強化機構與方法。
description.en: This course is a basic topics of Materials Science.

description.zh:
1.機率簡介
2.機率分佈
3.統計概論
4.抽樣分析
5.參數估計
6.區間估計
7.假設檢定
8.迴歸分佈
9.統計品管
10.變異分析
description.en:
Introduction to probability
Probability distribution
Introduction to statistics
Sampling analysis
Quality control

description.zh: 材料科學為工程教育的重要科技，材料的性質與特性，為現代工程設計中佔有相當重要的地位，金屬材料的各種性質，都基於其內部構造的變化，其內部原子聚集成規則的結晶構造，亦或聚集成非結晶構造，其所形成的各種物理特性，由最基本的結晶構造開始了解。電子顯微鏡，破壞力學，超導性，電傳導，超塑性，動態回復，動態時效應變。差排理論、結晶核的形成與成長，合金相理論，晶界自由度，鑄造物的成核與均質化，硬化現象，固體擴散現象，破壞現象及理論，潛變的形成與原因等，充分了解金屬材料特性上的理論基礎與變化軌跡。
description.en: Properties and characteristics of materials play important role in modern engineering design.Each property of materials is based on its transformation at inner structure, its atoms inside converge either a regulated crystal structure or a noncrystal structure, their physical property should be understood from the most fundamental crystalline structure, such as electronic microscope, destructive dynamics, super-conductivity, electronic conductivity, super-plasticity, dynamic recovery, dynamic aging strain , dislocation theory, the formation and growth of nucleus, alloy phase theory, degree of freedom of crystal boundary , nucleation and homogenization of casting product, hardening phenomenon, solid diffusion phenomenon, destructive phenomenon and theory, creep formation and its reason, all of these make student fully understand the theory basis and change record of the metallic material characteristics.

description.zh: 本學科對於再生、非再生資源以及資源再生之現象作一整體性的介紹，並配合原理及實例的講授，以期能對於工商業及一般生活的廢棄物或其附帶產生的低價值物料，經由處理而加以回收利用，避免資源的浪費。
description.en: Introduction the recycle of resources.

description.zh: 利用化學方法進行地質探勘
description.en: ntroduction to geochemical exploration

description.zh: 本實習著重在材料的合成法，包含人工晶體及各式無機材料的合成實作。實驗設計皆搭配「材料合成」授課內容，所得之樣品將進一步做表面與結構上的分析。核心實驗計有： (1)固態反應法合成鈦酸鋇粉末 (2)化學氣相沈積法沈積薄膜材料 (3)沉澱法合成磁性氧化鐵粉末 (4)溶膠─凝膠法合成二氧化矽粉末 (5) 溶膠─凝膠法合成二氧化矽薄膜 (6)氧化還原法合成金奈米顆粒 (7) 磷酸二氫銨晶體成長 (8) 物理氣相沈積法沈積金薄膜材料
description.en: The laboratory sections in this course are designed to synthesize various inorganic materials. Eight experiments will be carried out in a semester including: 1. Synthesis of BaTiO3 powders by solid-state reaction 2. Preparation of thin film by chemical vapor deposition 3. Synthesis of magnetic Fe3O4 powders by precipitation reaction 4. Synthesis of SiO2 powders by sol-gel reaction 5. Synthesis of SiO2 thin film by sol-gel reaction 6. Synthesis of Au nanoparticles by oxidation-reduction reaction 7. Crystal growth of NH4H2PO4 8. Preparation of gold thin film by physical vapor deposition.

name.en: The Marketing and Management of Cultural Industry

description.zh: 本課程旨在以文化事業發展為目標，將品牌價值極大化作為核心，分析新創品牌之經營策略，進而設計與執行品牌之行銷方案，以及創造出文化產業中的優勢品牌與品牌資產。
description.en: The course is designed to target the culture vocational development, emphasize the maximum of a brand value, decompose the strategy of a new brand value, design and implement its marketing programs, and then create the advantages of the brand equity in the cultural industry.

description.zh: 解析國內國家考試「會計學」之命題趨勢。並以實際國家考試考古題為案例，在解題過程中引導學生建立完整的會計理論體系，增進學生對會計理論的理解與應用能力，培養學生的邏輯思考、並增進解題技巧，順利通過國家考試。
description.en: Resolve domestic national examination "Accounting" Trend proposition. And the actual state exam archaeological entitled case in the problem solving process to guide students to build a complete system of accounting theory, enhance students' understanding of accounting theory and application capabilities, develop logical thinking of students, and enhance problem-solving skills, passed the national exam.

notes: 經管三、經管所與最後一哩合開

description.zh: 工藝產品設計是一門以實作為主，理論與實務講述為輔的工藝設計性創作課程。透過實務教學進行或參訪各類型藝文工作坊，提供學生視覺藝術與工藝設計等廣泛多元的文化創新課程。課程旨在結合工藝設計產出與微型創業的趨勢，從介紹工藝設計發展、材料種類、技法使用，到進入實作，並導入未來的創業精神。學生系統性的完成作品後，將透過展演形式發表成果。
description.en: This course will use a combination of lectures, demonstrations, field trip, and practical experiences to educate the student in the basic skills required to work as a member of craft and creative discipline. This class will also be an introduction to the business and craft of design for art and creative industries. Craft Product Design will provide an overview of the professional world of craft design through a practical exhibition.

description.zh: 掌握形式從屬機能旨意，熟悉施作技術限制與創意可行性，學習從設計到實作的落實，透過各種機械設備操作、加工技術學習，實際接觸及操作真實材料，了解材料種類、性質、加工過程、組裝知識、技術與美學等，以呈現設計作品之原型與成品。
description.en: Based on “Form follows Function”, student will learn interacts and limitations among technology feasibility and creative application, in order to master sequential implementations form design ideas to real works. Students are required to operate various mechanical equipment and processing technologies, thus to realize the types and nature of the materials, processing procedure, as well as the assembly of knowledge, technologies and aesthetics to format intended design prototypes and establishments.

name.zh: 互動科技應用之設計思考

description.zh: 本課程將透過課堂教學及實作分析，完整的教授設計思考之知識內涵與執行流程。將介紹設計思考的方法，包含同理心分析(Empathy)、問題定義(Define)、創意發想(Ideate)、原型設計(Prototype)、驗證(Test)。另也將導入實務操作之內容，使用開發版(例如Arduino UNO)設計實體互動裝置。從基礎程式應用入門，了解輸入與輸出之間的關係，對應到使用者行為與分析，設計出可與使用者互動之實體互動裝置。本課程的主要目標在於培養學生跨領域整合互動設計與技術解決問題的能力。
description.en: This course will provide students to learn the comprehensive knowledge and implementation flow of design thinking. This course will begin with the introduction of design thinking methods, such as Empathy, Define, Ideate, Prototype, and Test. Then, associated with these methods; this course will also introduce practical practices that use the development boards (such as: Arduino UNO) to provide students to learn the basic of tangible interaction programming applications. Finally, this course will use project-oriented methods that emphasize on the relational analysis between the input/output of programs and user interactions and behavior of tangible interaction installations. The major objective of this course is to provide students learn the capability of problem solving by using interdisciplinary integration of interactive design and technologies.

notes: 與資工二合開,修課上限50人

description.zh: 本課程主要的目標為從應用與設計的角度，切入擴增實境產業的各種可能性。從教育應用、設計工具以及擴增實境遊戲設計、擴增實境互動式動畫製作等，進行探討。
description.en: The main objective of the program, is taking from the application and design perspective, cut into the possibilities of virtual reality industry. Exploring from the educational applications, design tools and virtual reality games, to virtual reality interactive animation, etc.

notes: 修課上限50人,第二專長(A)/需至校外服務

description.zh: 基於學生畢業後的生涯發展，本課程目標旨在提供學生清楚認知未來的生涯發展，進而規劃自己的進路。針對設計學生畢業後的發展可以從學術界與實務界兩方面考量，學術界以直升研究所或工作後再修讀在職專班，而實務界則以可從事的相關職場做介紹與分析各行業的特色與前途，可擔任的職務名稱包括：互動設計師、互動程式設計師、使用者介面設計師、互動廣告企劃等，以供學生參考。
description.en: Based on the personal career development,  the course aims to provide a clearly scope and knowledge of future career development. This career can be analyzed in two categories, one is academic field that provide the master program and in-job training program; the another is practical field which concerns about more related design job, such as interaction designer, interactive programmer, user interface designer and interactive advertisement planner. This course not only introduces the design-related job, but also analyzes their characteristics and future development route.

description.zh: 本課程為財務會計領域之進階課程，針對已具初級會計學之學生深入講授財務會計之理論、觀念、方法及程序。本課程全面納入國際財務報導準則(IFRS)﹐內容包括：介紹財務報導觀念架構、主要財務報表編製、講解資產負債表中有關資產、負債、股東權益以及現金流量表與租賃會計等，修習本課程可使學生對IFRS有全面整體了解及運用之能力,亦有助於將來參加會計乙級、記帳士及公務人員高考等證照考試。
description.en: This curriculum enters the step curriculum for the financial accounting. Intermediate accounting requires ever increasing knowledge and refinement of skills. Our goal is to achieve the most educational effective blend of concepts and practice relation to the current intermediate accounting body of knowledge. This course strives to provide the material needed to understand this subject area using IFRS. It may also be helpful to participate in accountant the license test and the government workers examination.

description.zh: 本課程主要目的在於將個體經濟學相關理論引用至企業管理決策上。討論主題包括供給與需求理論、市場需求預測、廠商理論、成本利潤分析、市場結構、定價策略與競爭者分析等議題。希望同學修習本課程後，更能瞭解如何利用經濟分析工具，更加精準並有效率地解決實務上所面臨的重要經營管理議題。
description.en: The course covers microeconomic concepts relevant to managerial decision-making. Topics include demand and supply analysis, consumer demand forecasting, production and cost analysis, market structure, pricing policies and competitor analysis. This course will help students to have a better understanding of the economic tools and their potential use for solving real-world problems.

description.zh: 本課程的目的在提供修過基本統計課程的學生學習使用電腦軟體輔助進行統計分析的機會。R是目前最普遍使用的開放源碼統計軟體，也是在資料科學界裡，到目前為止最受歡迎的語言，若要挖掘大數據的祕密不可或缺，不但跨平台，而且有許多內建的統計函數、繪圖功能和自己的程式語言，對於幫助學生熟悉統計概念和程式設計，以便將來工作就業和進行研究都有不可或缺的幫助，是一套值得學習的工具軟體。本課程將涵蓋R程式的下載安裝、操作介面、繪圖指令、四則和函數運算、套件和程式開發、資料分析及統計應用等，修課學生需要曾經修過一門統計課程。
description.en: The goal of this course is to teach students how to use the open source software R for statistical analysis. R is currently the most commonly used free, open source, and cross-platform statistical software. It has many statistical functions, graphing tools, and its own programming language. Because of its many potential applications, the familiarity of this software could help students in the pursue of their chosen career paths, whether in industries or academic researches. This course will cover the various aspect of R, including installation, operation, data analysis, and program development. An entry-level statistical course is required before taking this course.

notes: 計網電腦教室；土木大三大四與防災所合開

description.zh: 工程地質對於工程結構物之規劃、設計、施工、維護等均有重要關係。本課程內容包括：(1)地質調查、(2)岩石之風化及其性質、(3)地下探查、(4)地球物理探測、(5)邊坡滑動與山坡、(6)建築物、結構物之基礎、(7)公路與鐵路、(8)隧道、(9)壩址地質調查。
description.en: Fundamentals of mineralogy,petrology,sedimentation,stratigraphy,and structural geology needed by environmental scientists to understant earth materials.

name.zh: 無人機攝影測量概論與實作

description.zh: 運用無人機技術做為測遙工具為一新穎科技，本課程以航空動力學為前題，分別介紹定翼及旋翼型無人機運作原理，基於航空攝影目的介紹飛行及航拍任務規劃。同時藉由實作，學生將自行組裝及設計無人機，並實際自行拍攝影像、產製所需之空間資訊，如:正射、地形等地理資訊系統圖資。
description.en: The Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV), commonly known as a drone, is an aircraft without human pilot on board that flies autonomously, and is now been used widely for many aspects because of its convenience, high resolution, efficiency, etc. This course introducing first the aerodynamic of different drone frames, as well as the basic photogrammetry. Then try to design and assembly our drones. By using the home-made drones, the students will learn how to do the mission planning and take photos. Finally, the students should generate the geomatic information from their acquired images.

notes: 土木大三與防災所合開(大學部限25人;研究所限15人)

name.en: Introduction of Disaster Prevention and Civil Engineering

description.zh: 講授土木工程領域之相關災害的種類、特性、影響，如地震、洪泛、坡地災害、土石流、施工災害、環境污染等。探討其災害消減及預防規劃，並藉由風險管理的觀念介紹緊急應變計畫的準則。
description.en:
This course introduces the types, characteristics and 
influences of civil engineering related disasters or hazards, such as earthquakes, floods, solpe failures, debris flows, and construction incidents. The hazard mitigation and precaution will also be discussed in class. By the concepts of risk management, the principle of emergency response plan will be introduced.

description.zh: 河溪生態工法導論包含河岸保護及復育，利用植生與土壤工程的結構系統保護湖泊、河口及河川，使其免受侵蝕。因此本課程授課內容將包含測量、逕流推估、水力學、基礎土壤工程、水工構造物、植草的水道及出口、蝕溝處裡、分水工、河川及濕地復育、施工材料及以土壤工程保護邊坡並降低沖蝕量。
description.en: Stream ecological engineering method consists of restoring and protecting banks of streams, lakes, estuaries, and excavated channels against scour and erosion by using vegetative plantings, soilengineering, and structural systems.  The content of this course includes engineering surveys, estimating runoff, hydraulics, elementary soils engineering, structure, grassed waterways and outlets, gully treatment, diversions, stream and wetland restorations, construction and construction materials, and soil bioengineering for upland slope protection and erosion reduction.

description.zh: 使學者了解水利工程實務及水利工程設計之基本原則。課程內容概要：(1)水利工程概述、(2)發電計畫、(3)有效落差(4)水路設計、(5)水路結構物設計、(6)水路結構物維護(7)其它。
description.en:
Scientific basis of the hydrologic cycle and its engineering 
implications;rainfall-runoff process,hydrographs,flood routing,and statisticalmethods.

description.zh: 使學者了解含地下水之水文循環概念、水文與統計之結合及實務講解，使理論與實務結合。課程內容概要：(1)水文學重點複習、(2)地下水、(3)小集水區洪峰流量推估、(4)洪水演算、(5)水文統計－頻率分析、(6)水文模式、(7)實例研析或專題討論。
description.en: Scientific basis of the hydrologic cycle and its engineering implications;rainfall-runoff process,hydrographs,flood routing,and statistical methods.

description.zh: 課程內容包含：(1)緒論、(2)運輸系統規劃、(3)公路工程概述、(4)交通工程概述、(5)鐵路工程概述、(6)航空工程概述、(7)港灣工程概述。
description.en:
Integrated transportation systems from the standpoint of assembly,haul,and distribution means.Analysis of transport
equipment and traveled way.Power requirements,speed, stopping,capacity,economics,route location.Future technological developments and innovations.

description.zh: 土木營造工程範圍廣泛，各種法營造工法更是不計其數，本課程教授學生幾種常見之施工法：一、土方工程：1.土壤調查2.挖方3.填方4.搬運5.軟弱地盤之處理6.土方作業計劃7.作業能力估算。二、混凝土工程：1.混凝土材料及其性質2.配比設計3.混凝土之攪料、灌置與搗實4.混凝土之養護與品質控制。三、基礎工程：1.基礎之種類2.淺基礎3.樁基礎4.沈箱5.深開挖及擋土工程6.圍堰7.灌漿。四、專項工程：1.河川工程2.海岸工程3.堰埧工程4.發電工程5.隊道工程6.橋梁工程7.港灣工程8.道路工程9.衛生下水道工程10. 鐵路工程11. 地下構造物工程12. 建築工程13. 機場工程。
description.en:
public work,improving the land and the enviorment,and preventing the harricoms.
Construction Methods includes elementary and applied methods.The purposes of this course are for students understanding the steps of various construction methods.

description.zh: 本課程主要教授學生七大項方向1.複習矩陣學2.結構矩陣學基本概念3.勁度法觀念4.勁度法解桁架問題5.勁度法解梁問題6.勁度法解剛架問題7.程式分析實習
description.en:
The course contents are divided into 7 major topics: 1. Review the matrix theory; 2.Basic concepts of the matrix structural theory; 3. Stiffness method; 
4. Using stiffness method to solve truss problem; 5. Using stiffness method to solve beam problem; 6. Using stiffness method to solve rigid frame problem; 7. Practice of the structural analysis program.

name.zh: 新聞英語及聽力訓練（二）

description.zh: 本課程目的在啟發學生英語聽力，分析及思辨能力。本課程自報紙，雜誌及電視選取豐富的新聞及媒體教材, 以訓練聽力及筆記的技巧。 此外，在課堂上將討論一些有爭議性的或者有趣的議題，以培養學生獨立思辨能力。
description.en: The course aims to develop the student's techniques of listening, analyzing and critical thinking in English. A variety of journalistic and media texts will be selected from newspapers, magazines and T.V. to reinforce listening training and note-taking skills. Besides, some controversial or interesting issues will be discussed in class to encourage the student's independent and critical thinking.

description.zh: 1.	營建組織介紹2.	營建工程概述   3.	預算與成本控制與管理   4.	進度控制與管理5.	施工計劃6.	工程發包與估算作業7.	物料與機具管理8.	合約與規範管理9.	安全衛生管理10.	品質管理
description.en: 1.	Introduction of the construction organization   2.	Introduction of the operation in the construction site  3.	Budget and cost control management   4.	Budget and cost control management5.	Planning of construction engineer project6.	Purchase and Estimate 7.	Material and Equipment control management8.	Contract and specification management9.	Safety and sanitation management10.	Quality control management

description.zh: 本課程主要介紹台灣現行依據都市更新條例相關法令推動都市更新之相關議題，透過理論與案例介紹瞭解台灣都市更新操作機制及趨勢。
description.en: a

description.zh: 本課程為每學期建築設計輔助配套課程，目的在協助同學加強必要的設計能力與技巧，並提升專業設計能力。同學也因此得以藉此課程加強自身的建築表現能力，例如表達、繪圖與獲得更進一步的構築知識。
description.en: As a parts and accessories to Architectural Design course, the goal of this seminar is to help students enhance their design proficiency superior to the excellent skill level of design. A student who completes this course will be able to perform a good presentation works such as oral, drawing, construction processing, etc. And will have better understanding in design presentation.

name.zh: BIM建築資訊系統實務及應用
name.en: The practice and application of Building Information Modeling (BIM)

description.zh: BIM在建築生命週期中，可借由3D視覺模擬於規畫設計階段相互溝通，施工階段時，最重要碰撞撿討、4D進度模擬、施工圖面整合，5D 估價計算，可協助建案進行更加順利。本課程除介紹BIM發展現況及各國相關証照外，並針對學生軟體工具使用再提升，以進階建模及整合之軟體操作為主。
description.en:
Building Information Modeling (BIM) in the building life cycle by 3D visual simulation in the design phase of the planning to communicate with each other, the construction phase, most important collision picking discuss the integration of 4D progress of the simulation, the construction drawings 5D valuation calculations, can assist in building cases smoothly.
This course introduces the BIM use of development status of countries and relevant certificates type. And re-enhancement for student software tools use Advanced modeling and integration of software operation.

description.zh:
本課程研究建築細部設計，並幫助學生發展建築和其組成元素之間的關係的理解，藉由分析和設計練習如何建造的邏輯、建築元素的製造與組構，接頭、以及整個結構的組織構成，以確保具備技能來面對在建築細部設計中的挑戰。
本課程也透過各種材料和工法的探究，以及銜接設計概念與構築過程，為學生在細部設計上提供多樣化的創作可能性。
description.en:
The course studies architectural detailing, and helps students to develop an understanding of the relationship of architecture and its elements, for ensuring their skills and capabilities to the challenges in detailing for architectures as well as researching the existing cases in built examples, through one series of trainings of analyzing and practicing the logic of construction, fabrication of architectural elements, joints, and the organization of entire structures. 
By engaging in various aspects of materials and methods, this course aims to provide students the unlimited creative possibilities in Detail Design by making connections between the design concept and fabrication processes.

description.zh: 本課程為每學期建築設計輔助配套課程，目的在協助同學加強必要的設計能力與技巧，並提升專業設計能力。同學也因此得以藉此課程加強自身的建築表現能力，例如表達、繪圖與獲得更進一步的構築知識。
description.en: As a parts and accessories to Architectural Design course, the goal of this seminar is to help students enhance their design proficiency superior to the excellent skill level of design. A student who completes this course will be able to perform a good presentation works such as oral, drawing, construction processing, etc. And will have better understanding in design presentation.

description.zh: 本課程內容分二部分進行授課，第一個部份以小組進行校園建築進行實測後，繪製平、立、剖面圖，以加強學生團隊合作，並透過實際量測與繪製建築平、立、剖面圖，使學生感受實體與練習之關係；由於目前臺灣多以集合住宅建照申請居多，且住宅為空間尺度之根本；因此，第二個部份之課堂操作，依序為浴廁、臥室、廚房、餐廳、客廳單元等不同空間尺度練習後，聚焦於住宅平面圖之練習；接著，透過住宅平面圖之練習，衍伸至立面圖與剖面圖與透視圖練習。課程亦將藉由同學上述二個部分之練習，延續第一學期建築製圖基本常識、觀念與技法之傳授，以確實增進學生建築製圖能力。 本課程符合系教育目標如下： 1. 訓練學生建築設計與工程基礎專業能力； 2. 透過實作方式彙整建築設計與建築構造之技能； 3. 引導建立建築專業道德倫理態度； 4. 整合建築理論與實務提升就業競爭力。
description.en: This course will need the knowledge from the previous course Architectural Graphics (1) and apply them into graphics; The course have two parts, first part of the course will split the class into small groups ,students will first measuring the school buildings and than draw them into three-dimensional diagrams. Second, lecture the detail graphics of residential building such as the floor plan, bathroom, bedroom, kitchen etc. and more drawing practice on cross section graphics and elevation graphics. During the semester Introduction to graphics will enable the students ready for second semester. After this course the students will acquire the following aspects: 1). Advance knowledge in architectural design and engineering. 2). Practical skill in architectural design and structure. 3). Correct attitude in architectural professions moral. 4). Integrate theory an

notes: 建築一與創意一合開（限主修建築系選課）

description.zh: 本課程主要在教導學生對西方(歐洲及西亞)認識歷史建築之演進過程與思考涵構，並使學生具備西方文化歷史與思想的相關知識，其主要授課內容如下：1.在範圍上--自古埃及、西亞、而收至古典建築、基督教建築、中世紀的大教堂時代以至文藝復興及17、18世紀的建築歷史。2.在思想上--自希臘的文化與哲學思想談起，以至各時代之政治、宗教與社會文明之演進，瞭解歷史涵構及其對建築的表現。3.在建築上─針對每一時期的建築表現，瞭解其構造方法、材料應用及相關細部特徵。

notes: 建築一與創意一合開（限主修建築系選課）

description.zh: 汽車設計概要，設計通則、材料，製造與設計的關係，汽車強度基準，引擎、底盤組件及車身之設計。
description.en: An Outline of Automotive Design， A Generality of Design，Relationships between Material，Production and Design，Standard of Automotive Strength，Design of the Components of Engine，Chassis and Body.

description.zh:
先修課程:4402012或負責教授同意
介紹各種不同方法分析（如能量法及 Castigliano 定理），破壞理論，材料選用，可靠度概念，軸及軸承，離合器及煞車器，傳動元件（如皮帶、鏈條、齒輪），軸聯接器，飛輪，彈簧等。
description.en: Introduction to Analysis Methods (Energy method & Castigliano theorem), Failure Theory, Material Selection, Introduction to Reliability, Shafts and Bearings, Clutches and Brakes, Power Transmission Elements (Belts, Chains, Gears), Couplings, Flywheels, Springs.

description.zh: 先修課程:負責教授同意．煞車動力學，煞車性能之極限，液壓煞車系統及元件，鼓式煞車，碟式煞車，駐車煞車，真空輔助動力煞車，液壓輔助動力煞車，電動輔助動力煞車，防鎖死煞車系統．
description.en: Brake Dynamics, LImit of Braking Performance, Hydraulic-Brake-System Components, Drum Brake, Disc Brake, Parking Brake, Vacuum-Assist Power Brake, Hydraulic-Assist Power Brake, Electro-Hydraulic-Assist Power Brake, Antilock Brakes System。

description.zh: 介紹各種能源技術，包括：木柴能源、水力能源、風力能源、煤炭能源、蒸汽能源、石油能源、天然氣能源、太陽能源、核能、海洋能、磁浮能、電池、燃料電池等。以及節約能源技術與能源管理。
description.en: Introduction of Energy Technology. Include: Wood, Hydraulic, Wind, Coal, Steam, Petroleum, Natural Gas, Solar Energy, Nuclear Energy, Ocean, Magnetism, Battery, Fuel Cell…etc. Energy conservation and Energy management.

description.zh: 運動方程式，一維振動（自由及強制），振動量測，二維振動，多維振動及機械應用說明。
description.en: Equation of Motion, Single-Degree-of-Freedom Vibration (Free and Forced), Measurement of Vibrations, Two-Degree-of-Freedom Vibration, Multiple- Degree-of-Freedom Vibration and its Applications in Mechanical Engineering.

name.en: Management and Leadership of a Team

description.zh: 本課程藉「課程引導」來協助學生探索自身潛能，認識與學習未來擔任領導者經營團隊之能力；另透過編組進行「實務參與」，進而體驗提升團隊能量之方式，並在投入的過程當中，學習組織與企劃、接納與包容、宣傳與分工、建構人脈關係網以及增進問題解決能力，以培養未來職場之領袖人才。最後藉由期末成果發表會，引導學生結合學術理論基礎及業界實務操作，將所學做最好之發揮，協助同學未來於職場工作無縫銜接之目標。
description.en: The “course guidance” assists students to explore self-potential and to recognize and learn the team-management capability of the future leader. The “Practical participation” let students experience how to increase team-energy, and study: organizing and planning, accepting and tolerating, propaganda and cooperation, constructing personal connections, problem solving, for cultivating the future leader. Finally, an achievements ceremony will be held to show the results and train the students to combine the theoretical principal and practical application for their future work.

notes: 車輛四與最後一哩合開

description.zh:
先修課程:4402014或負責教授同意
柴油引擎概說，柴油之類別，特性與燃燒分析，柴油引擎與汽油引擎之比較，柴油引擎之類別與用途，柴油引擎之循環理論與工作分析，柴油引擎系統之主要構件、類別與特性分析，柴油引擎進排氣系統與環保控制裝置，柴油引擎之啟動設備，柴油引擎之其他配件與自動化，柴油引擎之特性數據與性能分析，柴油引擎之未來發展。
description.en: Diesel Engine Models, Combustion Analysis, Working Cycles Analysis, Major Components, Exhaust and Emission Control, Starting System, Performance Test and Analysis, Future Development.

description.zh: 本課程以提升學生英文能力，至全民英檢中級以上的程度為目標。教學內容以加強學生日常生活中，如：購物、旅遊、定餐等用語之溝通、運用、表達及閱讀寫作等能力為主。
description.en: The goal of this course is to help students enhance their English proficiency superior to the Intermediate Level of General English Proficiency Test. A student who completes this course will be able to perform routine daily communication such as travel, shopping, ordering a meal, etc. and will have better understanding in reading and writing.

description.zh:
先修課程：無。本實習內容為汽車電系實習，包括：引擎電系，起動系統及充電系統檢測，點火系統檢測，電池之檢測與換裝，電腦控制系統檢測，電腦診斷系統，檢測車輛新式電子設備，檢修汽車空調系統。
95學年度前入學者適用下列實習內容: 結構力學分析與實習。學生將學習使用套裝電腦應用軟體，了解並學習如何做常用的結構力學前處理、分析及後處理。 課程著重學生實作練習。
description.en:
Automobile Electrical System Service Shop Practice , Include Service of the Engine Electrical System , Starting and Charging System, Ignition System, Battery inspection and replacement, Computer Control System, Computer Diagnostic System, New Electronic Equipment Inspection , Air Condition Test and Repair.
For those students who enter the school before 2006 Fall Semester , this class is to utilize computers to do the experiments on different vehicle/engineering problems. Student will learn the basic concept of Finite Element Method (FEM), learn how to utilize FEM in Vehicle Engineering to solve problems. Classes include Geometry modeling, creating FEA models, learning different analysis types (such as Statics, Normal mode, Buckling, and Optimization).

notes: 車輛二三四合開/修課人數限25人，高年級優先

name.zh: 汽車檢診設備操作實務

description.zh: 汽車檢診設備操作實務內容包括輪胎平衡與校正、車輛四輪定位診斷與校正、輪胎拆卸操作與油電系統故障的檢測。學生將學習儀器操作的基本要求，並練習熟練適當工具的使用，課程著重學生實作演練。
description.en: Automotive diagnostic equipment operating practices include tire balance, vehicle wheel alignment, Changing tire operation and hybrid electric system failures inspections. Students will learn the basic requirements of instrument operation and practice with appropriate tools. This course focuses on the implementation of the exercise.

name.zh: 汽車檢診設備操作實務

description.zh: 汽車檢診設備操作實務內容包括輪胎平衡與校正、車輛四輪定位診斷與校正、輪胎拆卸操作與油電系統故障的檢測。學生將學習儀器操作的基本要求，並練習熟練適當工具的使用，課程著重學生實作演練。
description.en: Automotive diagnostic equipment operating practices include tire balance, vehicle wheel alignment, Changing tire operation and hybrid electric system failures inspections. Students will learn the basic requirements of instrument operation and practice with appropriate tools. This course focuses on the implementation of the exercise.

description.zh: 本課程綜合的介紹電化學之原理與其應用.在原理方面包括離子之作用及其平衡,電解質之導電性質,界面現象,電極電位,電化學電池和電極動力程序等內容.而在應用方面則涵蓋溶液物理參數測量,電化學分析技術,電化學感應器,電鍍,表面處理,金屬腐蝕防治,電池,電透析和電合成等
description.en: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to principles of electrochemistry and its applications. In the principles which includes ionic interaction, ionic equilibrium, the conducting properties of electrolytes, interfacial phenomena, electrode potentials, electrochemical cells and electrode kinetic process. For the application covers determination of physical parameters in the solutions, electroanalytical techniques, electroplating, electrochemical sensors, surface finishing, metal corrosion prevention, cells, electrodialysis, and electrosynthesis etc.

description.zh: 本課程教授非線性方程式、聯立方程式、常微分方程式及偏微分方程式等之數值解答技巧，並在電腦輔助下解決工程上之問題。
description.en: This course is a way to do higher mathematics problems on a computer.  It includes solving nonlinear equations, sets of equations, interpolation and curving fitting, numerical differentiation and integration, and differential equations.

notes: 計網電腦教室，限60人；化工大四合開

description.zh: 本課程不同於一般的日文課，主要講解如何讀懂日文科技文章，著重於讀及科技文章的內容，教授內容以讀懂科技日文所需的基礎與概念，本課程介紹從基礎的五十音、助詞、動詞變化、形容詞變化等，到語法結構、長句讀解、常用語法句型進行系統性解說，以期建立修讀者自行解讀科技日文的能力與技巧。
description.en: This is not an entry level Japanese course; therefore, prerequisites of basic Japanese will be required. This lecture will focus on teaching students to read scientific or technological Japanese papers. In the lecture, students will be taught the knowledge and technology on reading Japanese papers, such as basic letters, auxiliary preposition, elementary grammars, sentence structures and the reading of long sentences, which are often appeared in Japanese scientific papers, as well as generally used sentence patterns in scientific Japanese. After learned this lecture, the students are expected to have the abilities and skills for reading scientific articles by themselves.

description.zh: 「生命科學與工程」課程融合生物與工程兩門學科，內容涵蓋生命科學領域（分子、細胞、組織、器官、系統、個體、行為等）及工程領域（化學、化工、材料、電子、電機、機械、土木等，以及影像、量測、模式等方法）。授課內容盡量以引發學生興趣為主，目的在使工程領域的學生能明白生命科學對工程設計的影響，以及使生物領域的學生能瞭解工程對於生命科學的幫助；兩者相輔相成，相互影響。
description.en: This course is designed for undergraduate engineering students with the objective of introducing the fundamentals of life sciences while pointing out the areas in which engineering plays a pivotal role in the advent. Students are to be provided with perspectives on the interplay between biology, engineering, and biotechnology, with emphasis on the quantitative and integrative nature of biological and bioengineering problems. The contributions of engineering to life science are illustrated with the design and manufacturing of tools essential for observations and applications in medicine, agriculture and environment.

description.zh: 介紹晶體形成過程、相變化與結構狀態、物性與化性關係以及其有關之探討技術與應用。
description.en: Solid state chemistry introduces the process of the crystal growth, phase change and the structural state.  The course also discusses the relationship of its chemical and physical properties.

notes: 化工大四與化工所合開

name.en: Management of entrepreneurship, brand, and intellectual property

description.zh:
本課程為培育學生創業與品牌智財管理能力的課程。課程規劃一系列主題講座，邀請不同領域的專家學者組成授課團隊，分享自己的創業與品牌智財管理經驗，著重培養學生的創業管理能力，品牌管理能力
與智財管理能力。
description.en: The objective of this course is to develop the management abilities of entrepreneurship, brand, and intellectual property for students. The curriculum is designed to include the special lectures given by the experts in various fields. The lecture will focus on the experience sharing and case studies.

notes: 化工大四與化工所合開

description.zh: 本課程首先介紹社區的階層意義及規劃程序及方法，其次舊社區規劃的主要內涵包括土地使用規劃、運輸規劃、公共設施規劃各以理論發展及案例操作說明，尤其是土地使用與運輸規劃之整合及鄰避性公共設施規劃案例之舉證。在就社區規劃後之整體開發方式說明，如何由二度的平面規劃成為三度空間的開發。期中考後將針對更前瞻性及更細緻的規劃技巧作為授課的內容，包括生態社區規劃的方法、災害及防災規劃，並舉科技的發展包括網際網路及捷運之發達對社區規劃的衝擊及因應。最後舉全球化及競爭力對社區發展的影響。另外以本人服務於實務界多年，得由同學指定欲瞭解或探討的課題由教師準備講授，以增加共同討論的意願，冀讓同學能對生活的空間有個全貌的初識。二個學分的課程僅能讓同學對環境有所管窺，希望加上其他的課程，讓同學進而因之他、關懷他、愛他而願意以專業與他結緣終生，那怕我們沒有好的居住環境！
description.en: This course is an introduction on the meaning of community hierarchy, the procedure and methodology of planning, as well as theoretical developments and case studies regarding major planning issues such as land use, transportation, and case studies on NIMBY facilities.Furthermore, I will also demonstrate planned unit developments and how to transform a two-dimensional planning into a three-dimensional development.After the midterm, I'll focus on more foresighted and deliberate planning techniques, including ecological community planning methods, disaster-preventive, planning, and the possible coping measures with respect to the impacts resulting from technological advances such as the internet and the mass transit systems. At the end, I'll also cover topics regarding the impacts of globalization and competition upon community developments.As I have had a lot of empirical experiences from my job, the students are allow to specify some topics or issues for this class so that the students

notes: 建築四、職二建五、創意四合開

description.zh: 因應數位科技時代的急遽轉變特質，本課程教學內容兼具經典理論與最新趨勢，從何謂新媒體與其衍生之文化到討論與傳統大眾傳播媒介環境的衝擊與共存，以其視角去探討不同媒體的設計與文化理論基礎，也著重時下的行業與個人使用新科技的使用者體驗，並協助學生了解不同類型的新媒體傳播與文化運作模式。同學們可以從課堂的講授、閱讀、討論、與作業中對學術的研究與理論，以及進入新媒體或跨平台傳播產業都做好準備。總體來說，本課程以文化與心理理論為底蘊，與同學一起探討思考新媒體科技對於個人、人際、社會、以及全球的影響，培養同學持續的自我思考與社會關懷。
description.en: This course aims to focus on both classic theories as well as the latest trends in response to the changing nature of this digital age. Students will learn fundamental knowledge about the definition of new media and its cultures and its conflicts and coexistence with traditional mass media. The associations among digital media, user experience, and organizational models will also be analyzed. This course will provide students with necessary knowledge for academic research as well as new media industries. This course will help students explore, understand how digital media affects individuals, the society, and the globe with in-depth discussions of psychology and cultural studies. This course will also encourage students to reflect on themselves and care about the world.

name.zh: 進階陶瓷文物修復與預防性維護
name.en: Advanced Ceramic Cultural Relics Repair and Preventive Maintenance

description.zh: 此課程以台灣裝飾藝術屋脊、規帶、排頭，及水車堵等部位，除水車堵多為交阯裝飾外，屋頂多做剪黏，二者互為表裡，一般以剪黏變化較大，不受燒窯限制，多置於屋外，另一原因是製作費用較低，但立名、技巧均須受過多年訓練始得競其功，未捏麵訓練為此相關準備之課程。
description.en: This course aims to conduct the Taiwan decorative art roof, rules, Pai Tau, the water tankers blocking, parts, except water tankers blocking more for make site decorative outside. The classical top roofs more do cut sticky, both mutual for exterior. General to cut sticky changes larger, not by burn kiln limit, more placed housing outside, another a reasons is making costs lower, but state name, and skills are must trained years training began have competing its work, dough training preparing for the relevant courses.

description.zh: 當代飾品設計及製作是一門以實作為主，實務講述為輔的設計性課程。透過實務教學進行，提供學生基礎金工珠寶的製作能力並進行應用。課程旨在結合金屬工藝與多元媒材的當代趨勢，引導學生系統性的完成作品後，將透過展演形式發表成果。
description.en: This course will use a combination of lectures, demonstrations, and practical experiences to educate the student in the basic skills required to work as a member of jewelry design discipline. This class will also be an introduction to the multiple media of design. Contemporary Jewelry Design will provide an overview of the professional world of Jewelry design through a practical exhibition.

name.zh: 產業發展與文化資產專題

description.zh: 本課程探討產業發展歷程中，產業文化資產的出現、保存與再利用等課題。透過文獻研讀、議題討論、國內外個案研討、實地參訪、參與學術研討會、作業報告等方式，學習三課題：1.產業發展歷程中文化資產的出現、保存與再利用；2.我國產業文化資產清查保存與再生計畫之核心主軸；3.民間運用產業文化資產開發新事業。
description.en: This course explores the issues of the appearance, preservation and reuse of industrial Cultural Heritage in the process of industrial development. Through the literature study, discussion topics, domestic and foreign case studies, field visits, participation in academic seminars, job reports, etc., to learn 3 topics ：1.The issues of the appearance, preservation and reuse of industrial ccultural heritage in the process of industrial development , 2. The core spindle of Taiwan's Government industrial heritage inventory preservation and regeneration plan, 3. Private sector utilize industrial ccultural heritage to develop new businesses.

description.zh: 本課程將分理論、作品研讀與實地操作三部份。首先介紹口述歷史與田野調查理論。之後透過研讀相關作品瞭解該主題之歷史。在理論與實例示範的基礎之下，修課學生擬定田野調查地或口述主題，並定期報告進行情況，期末需有成果報告的分享與討論。
description.en: This course is divided into theory, work study and field operation. Under the basis of theory and model demonstration, students will choose one topic and report it regularly. At the end of this semester, a final report is needed.

description.zh: 量化研究是當代社會與行為科學的強勢典範，統計分析則是量化研究的核心，本課程之目標在於介紹量化方法研究學理、統計知識與基本統計軟體的操作技巧，俾使學生具備使用量化資料驗證研究假設、閱讀統計報表、撰寫研究報告的能力。
description.en: The objective of the course is to introduce the theories of quantitative research, basic knowledge about statistics, and the skills of statistics package software in order to enable students to test the hypotheses via quantitative data, interpret report results, and write formal academic reports.

description.zh: 這是一堂理論與實務兼具的課程，同學們將學習並運用相關之人機互動(HCI)、傳播、與行銷理論，並透過一系列文字、影像、聲音、影片、動畫的製作與賞析來探討數位媒體互動性與敘事手法，並比較與傳統大眾媒介文本之相似與不同，涵蓋的內容主題包含正向敘事、業配行銷、個人塑造、單位形象、病毒式敘事等。這門課會探討數位敘事與可能的閱聽人效果，接著介紹超文本、數位符碼、多媒體結合、社群媒體、與高互動環境的優點與限制，並練習課堂所介紹的數位媒體科技應用的設計與手法(例如拍攝、剪輯、分鏡、鏡頭語言、修圖、特效、光線設計、創意腳本等)，學生也會透過實證研究提案來反思數位敘事的定位、影響、與未來。
description.en: This course will integrate theories and practical training to help students learn knowledge associated with human-computer interaction (HCI), communication, and marketing. Students will explore new media interactivity and storytelling through a series of assignments that examine texts, images, sounds, videos, and animation. This course will discuss a variety of topics, such as positive storytelling, sponsored marketing, personal branding, virus marketing, etc. This course will also investigate digital storytelling and its impacts, hypertexts, digital symbols, multimedia convergence, social media, and high interactive environment. Students will also have opportunities to practice different digital media design skills, such as editing, creating storyboard, lighting, camera/lens languages, special effects, etc. Students will also discuss the role, impacts, and future of digital storytelling via proposing an original empirical research study.

description.zh: 本課程將與結合社區力量，透過對艋舺龍山寺周邊人文歷史、社會民俗、商業變遷等，討論艋舺代表性的台灣本土文化。
description.en: The course will combine the power of the community, through the periphery of the Longshan Temple in Wanhua human history, social customs, commerce, etc. Changes to discuss Monga representative of Taiwanese culture.

notes: 文發三四與文發所合開

description.zh: 以視覺藝術為探討重點，研究藝術起源以及原始美術、民俗與大眾藝術分野。探究式覺元素和設計原理以及應用媒材、使用技巧，涵蓋素描、水彩、油畫、版畫、混合媒材、雕塑、建築，廣告、包裝、服裝設計、工業產品設計及攝影等。配合幻燈教學，使同學對於視覺藝術有整體性、概括性的認識，以奠定將來從事藝術鑑賞和研究創造之基礎。
description.en: The focus of this course is the exploration of visual arts.  Students will study the origin of art and the distinction among primitive art, folk and popular art. This course also provides students with visual elements, design principles, applied media material, and techniques including charcoal drawing, water-colored painting, oil painting, graphic art, compound material, sculpture, architecture, advertisement, packaging, fashion design, industrial design, and photography. Slide teaching is adopted to give students a comprehensive and general understanding on visual art in order to foster students to appreciate, study, and create art.

description.zh: 本課程旨在培養學生成為具有深度文化視覺的科技人。從認識本土文化為起點，進而認識世界文化。引導學生如何探究文化現象，並且深入文化的精神境界，物質境界，瞭解文化價值與文化傳統，讓文化觀點充分融入個人的思維內涵。
description.en: The main purpose of this course is to develop the cultural cultivation of our technology majored students. Starting with the culture of our own land and extending to world-wide culture. The teachers would guide the students to explore the phenomena of the culture, and try to find out both the spirit and the material of the culture. Through the understanding of the worth and the tradition of the culture, the students might merge the cultural cultivation into their personal thinking.

description.zh: 本課程旨在培養學生成為具有豐富文學素養的科技人。引導學生如何探索文學作品，認識各種不同類型文學作品的發展歷程，以及每個重要發展階段的寫作理念，指標作家與作品。課程中將探討東西方古今詩詞、散文、小說、戲劇等文學類型的特點，透過分析作品，解讀作品，奠立遨遊世界文學堂奧的基礎。
description.en: The main purpose of this course is to enrich the literary taste of our technology majored students. The teachers would guide the students to explore the master pieces in the literary world, to know the different types of works with their development, and also the main writing theory in each period. Of course, the representative writers and their works would be introduced. During the course, regardless of the characters of western, east or ancient, modern literature, including poem, essay, novel and drama, would all be discussed. Through the internalization and reading the articles, the students might lay a foundation in the grand universal literary world.

description.zh: 台灣的歷史從無文字傳統的原住民起，到17世紀西班牙、荷蘭海上競逐開始，漢人隨之移墾台灣，成為這塊土地最主要的住民。本課程的內容將依時間先後，將荷蘭西班牙殖民時期、鄭氏王國、清代台灣、日治時期與國民政府時期重要歷史大事、人物等依據講義講解，內容有政治、宗教、文化、經濟、社會等各層面的重要事件、人物以及歷史發展。
description.en: The history of Taiwan originated from the aboriginal culture in which no written languages were included. In the 17th century when the Spanish and the Netherlands were competing for the maritime power, the Hans immigrated into the island and became the main resident. The course will be taught in the temporal order: colonial periods under the Spanish and the Netherlands, Zheng's Kingdom, Taiwan under the Qing Dynasty, Taiwan under the Japanese Domination and Taiwan under the Nationalist Government. All the significant events and important figures will be discussed in class--on politics, religion, culture, economy and social development.

description.zh: 本課程的設計以歷史趨勢的闡述及專題研究分析二方面同時進行。課程方面包括中、西歷史觀念的比較與中國歷代政治、經濟、社會、文化的歷史演進，藉以幫助學生認識時代之趨勢與意義。授課方式以口頭講述為主，討論及書面報告為輔，期使學生在短時間內，能對中國歷史有一簡要而清晰的了解，深化學生的歷史感。
description.en: Methodologically, the course is performed in two ways at the same time: interpretation of historical trends as well as the study and analysis of specific topics. The course will cover: comparison of historical concepts and the historical development of a long term of Chinese history in the fields of politics, economics, society and culture so that the students who take this course will sure understand better the trends and significance as the historical time spans go by. Class activities are made up of: lectures, student discussion and paper presentation. The students who take this course will have a brief but clear understanding of the Chinese history in a short time-thus embedding themselves with a deeper sense of history.

description.zh: 多元文化不僅是當今世界的主流人文思維，也代表一種普世價值觀，更是全球人類彼此互動往來--地球村的基調。這門課主要是引導學生探討文化的意義，以及文化史的內涵，希望在有限的時間內，重點式的的介紹世界各主要國家的文化特色，經由對異文化的認識與比較，能夠協助學生建立較寬闊而多元的文化認知及價值取向。
description.en: Multi-culture is emerging as the mainstream field of humanities, involving not only a representation of universalism but also an interwoven tapestry of cross-cultural communication, which forms the fundamental structure of a global village. This course is to inspire students to search for the meaning of distinct cultures as well as the essence of cultural.

This course is to inspire students to search for the meaning of distinct cultures as well as the essence of cultural.

description.zh:
法學概論，顧名思義是在介紹法律原理，以啟發學生法學研究的興趣。然而，法學涵蓋的層面甚廣，法學緒論的課程，只能大略介紹各種法律的共通原理，就繁駁的法律現象，作綜合的引說，俾使初學法律的人，不僅能粗知「實定法」的共通原則，還可藉此原則來培養法律見解和修養，執簡馭繁，因而體會法律的性質、內涵和理念。
有關本課程的教授方式，擬先介紹法律的基概念及原理，並以答問之方式訓練學生邏輯反思的能力，同時輔以日常屢見之法律實例問題。如此，學生不僅可以可以學習正確的法律觀念和知識，並可培養縝密思辨的能力，將課堂上所習得的知識應用落實在日常生活中，以達保障並維護自己及他人權益之目的。
description.en: Introduction of Law is to introduce the theory of law and to promote students' interest to study law. Since the field of law is very broad but the time is limited, this course can briefly explain common principles of law, complex phenomena of law, etc. The main purpose of this course is to let students catch the concept of common principles of "lex scripta."  Also, this course aims to promote students' knowledge about law, thus cultivating their spirit of abiding by law.  This course will introduce the basic concept and theory of law first. Then students will be given logical training through discussion.  Besides, the general cases and problems of law will be covered as well. Through this course, students can not only get correct concepts of law, but learn to protect their/others' right.

description.zh:

description.zh: 新經濟與舊經濟的分野不是在有『e』還是沒有『e』，而是在有『i』還是沒有『i』，而『i』就是『Innovation，創新』。二十一世紀的『腦力經濟』最重要的戲規則就是『智慧財產權』，同時也是WTO會員國必須遵守的重要規範之一。課程內容主要包括三個最基本的智慧財產權課題：專利權，商標權，以及著作權；而為配合本校學生學科背景，本課程將較著重於『專利』方面的實務知識，並且講授『如何激發創意，以培養學生日後能好好應用『智慧財產權』的保護。
description.en: The difference between New-economy and Old-economy is not caused by having "e" or not having "e", but caused by owining "i" or not owning "i". where "I" means "Innovation:.  Intellectual Property is not only the most importance business rule of the :Brain economy era:, but also one of the most important agreements among WTO members.  This course includes the basic three subjects of Intellectual Property:Patent, Trademark, and Copyright.  In order to accommodate the learning background for most of NTUT students, the contents of this course will focus more on the practical practice of the Patennt.  In addition, it also includes the subject of "how to activate your creativeness:so as to make students can use what they learn, "Intellectual Property:, to protect their intellectual work.

description.zh: 本課程主要在介紹中華民國憲法、探討憲政體制的運作、人民權利義務的規範及相關法律的適用等問題。期能使學生認知國家民主法治的實施狀況，維護社會秩序與個人基本權利，進而體現人性尊嚴的價值。
description.en: This course focuses the discussions on the Constitution of the Republic of China,constitutional mechanism, the rights and obligations for the people and legitimate operations of the society. It is our hope that the students may have a better understanding on how the democracy is performed in our country as well as on how to preserve social security and basic human rights of the individuals-with the realization of human dignity as our extreme goal.

description.zh:
法學概論，顧名思義是在介紹法律原理，以啟發學生法學研究的興趣。然而，法學涵蓋的層面甚廣，法學緒論的課程，只能大略介紹各種法律的共通原理，就繁駁的法律現象，作綜合的引說，俾使初學法律的人，不僅能粗知「實定法」的共通原則，還可藉此原則來培養法律見解和修養，執簡馭繁，因而體會法律的性質、內涵和理念。
有關本課程的教授方式，擬先介紹法律的基概念及原理，並以答問之方式訓練學生邏輯反思的能力，同時輔以日常屢見之法律實例問題。如此，學生不僅可以可以學習正確的法律觀念和知識，並可培養縝密思辨的能力，將課堂上所習得的知識應用落實在日常生活中，以達保障並維護自己及他人權益之目的。
description.en: Introduction of Law is to introduce the theory of law and to promote students' interest to study law. Since the field of law is very broad but the time is limited, this course can briefly explain common principles of law, complex phenomena of law, etc. The main purpose of this course is to let students catch the concept of common principles of "lex scripta."  Also, this course aims to promote students' knowledge about law, thus cultivating their spirit of abiding by law.  This course will introduce the basic concept and theory of law first. Then students will be given logical training through discussion.  Besides, the general cases and problems of law will be covered as well. Through this course, students can not only get correct concepts of law, but learn to protect their/others' right.

description.zh: 新經濟與舊經濟的分野不是在有『e』還是沒有『e』，而是在有『i』還是沒有『i』，而『i』就是『Innovation，創新』。二十一世紀的『腦力經濟』最重要的戲規則就是『智慧財產權』，同時也是WTO會員國必須遵守的重要規範之一。課程內容主要包括三個最基本的智慧財產權課題：專利權，商標權，以及著作權；而為配合本校學生學科背景，本課程將較著重於『專利』方面的實務知識，並且講授『如何激發創意，以培養學生日後能好好應用『智慧財產權』的保護。
description.en: The difference between New-economy and Old-economy is not caused by having "e" or not having "e", but caused by owining "i" or not owning "i". where "I" means "Innovation:.  Intellectual Property is not only the most importance business rule of the :Brain economy era:, but also one of the most important agreements among WTO members.  This course includes the basic three subjects of Intellectual Property:Patent, Trademark, and Copyright.  In order to accommodate the learning background for most of NTUT students, the contents of this course will focus more on the practical practice of the Patennt.  In addition, it also includes the subject of "how to activate your creativeness:so as to make students can use what they learn, "Intellectual Property:, to protect their intellectual work.

description.zh: 本課程主要在介紹中華民國憲法、探討憲政體制的運作、人民權利義務的規範及相關法律的適用等問題。期能使學生認知國家民主法治的實施狀況，維護社會秩序與個人基本權利，進而體現人性尊嚴的價值。
description.en: This course focuses the discussions on the Constitution of the Republic of China,constitutional mechanism, the rights and obligations for the people and legitimate operations of the society. It is our hope that the students may have a better understanding on how the democracy is performed in our country as well as on how to preserve social security and basic human rights of the individuals-with the realization of human dignity as our extreme goal.

description.zh: 生命科學概論，重心放在人體生命科學，並強化醫學的角色。此外，中西醫結合的觀點，詮釋抗老、防癌。以身心靈養生的方式，強化預防醫學。並從人類疾病的本源性病因，根本探討。當然，如何增強免疫力，袪除自由基是主軸。在探究人體潛能、身心靈養生或疾病的本源性原因時，都必須重視「經絡」系統。總之生命是非常奧妙的，不僅只物質面，更要重視心靈層面，中西醫整合方向，必是廿一世紀的主流。
description.en: This course focuses on human life science and emphasizes the roles of medicine on improving the life quality of human beings. It also uses the point of view of integration traditional Chinese and western medicine to interpret how to prevent the aging of body and occurrence of cancers. This course also focuses on how to keep the body, mind and spirit in the best conditon in order to prevent the occurrence of human diseases. In addition, it deeply discusses the eseential etiology of human disease and teaches audiences how to enhance the body immunity and how to get rid of free radicals. The importance of meridian system of the human body and its relationships to human potentiality, body, mind spirit and diseses are also discussed. Life is marvelous. The completeness of life depends on the saisfaction of not only the material but also menetal and spiritual needs. Integration of the traditional Chinese and western medicine to improve the life quality of human beings is the main issue.

description.zh: 學習邏輯推理主要的目的便是幫助我們培養一種邏輯能力，使我們能夠為我們的人生做出正確的判斷。本課程包括:邏輯的基本觀念，真值表推論法，語句邏輯中自然演繹法的18條基本推論規則，語句邏輯的基本公理系統，量化邏輯中自然演繹法的基本規論推測，量化邏輯的詮釋方法，量化邏輯的基本公理系統，語句邏輯的後設理論，量化邏輯的後設理論，傳統的三段論法，謬誤理論、與介於自然與形式語言之間的翻譯等等。
description.en: The main purpose of studying "Logical Inference" is to help us obtain a kind of logical ability, by means of which we will be able to make right choices for our life. This courses covers at least the following topics: basic ideas in logic, the truth table method, 18 basic rules of inference in the method of natural deduction in sentential logic, basic axiomatic systems in sentential logic, basic rules of inference in the method of natural deduction in quantificational logic, interpretations in quantificational logic, basic axiomatic systems in quantificational logic, meta-theorem in sentential logic, meta-theorem in quantificational logic, traditional syllogism, the fallacy theory, and the translation between natural and formal language, etc.

description.zh: 生態與環境保護是廿世紀的新課題，也是人類目前及未來所面臨的最大考驗。因為環境問題是超越國界的，因此環境的保護是每個人都必須瞭解的，也是每個人應盡的責任。本課程首先在了解生態環境與生活素質的關係，並了解環境污染問題的產生及其分類，再就台灣環境問題之所在分析其根源，最後了解台灣環境實施之現況後，並共同研究解決之道。
description.en: Introduction to Ecology and Environmental Protection is a brand new issue of the 20th century; also, it is the biggest challenge of all human beings and our offspring. Because environmental protection is an international issue, everyone got to realize its importance and take some action. This lesson is designed to help students understand the connection between our ecological environment and our living condition, the environmental pollution problems and their classification, the environmental problems in Taiwan, and the solution to Taiwan's environmental problems after the situation introduction.

description.zh: 本課程是為非專業學生所設計的哲學概論，介紹西洋哲學的起源、西洋哲學的問題，以及哲學與人生的關係。哲學的問題意識起自人類的自覺，人類意圖認識自己，為宇宙人生尋求解答，哲學的發生本自人類天賦的求知欲，即其本性中對於智慧的追求與愛慕。這種愛慕智慧的精神是希臘文明留給西方世界的遺產，對於知識能持客觀批判的精神，對於真理能存認真熱切的態度，對於人生能有超克苦難的修持。在國際化的世代，我們對西方的認識應更深入其精神層面，此乃本課程規劃的初衷。
description.en: This course is designed for student who is not disciplined in philosophy. As an introduction, we begin at the origin of western philosophy, the philosophical questions and finally, the relationship of human life and philosophy. Philosophy takes place when human being thinking of himself. Man by nature desire to know himself as well as the external world. And due to this love of wisdom, men can be critical to knowledge and be passionate toward truth. Eventually, grasping the sprit of western philosophy , we can view our life in quite a different view. In our time, facing the world of international, we should better understand the western culture, which is rooted in philosophy.

description.zh:
經濟學重視邏輯與嚴謹推理的理性特質是其主要特色，此亦為理工科系人之專長優勢，然而僅偏重左腦訓練的人才往往讓人覺得生冷機械，對事物看法也常過於直接而缺乏人情，若能在不失理性效率之下，兼顧以人為本之社會人文感性關懷，則經濟學自無愧為社會科學之母，其訓練目標亦與通識教育的人格均衡發展目的一致！
為避免陷入一般經濟教學因理論工具比重過高而失焦，導致學生學習興趣驟減以致成效不彰，本課程重點在於先讓學生擁有強烈之學習動機，接著認知到"確立學習目的"的重要性，藉由生活實例直接帶領學生面對並感受問題，從而引導出經濟學切入問題的思維方式，並傳授其正確可行的學習態度與方法，同時提醒學生維持對專業知識批判的精神，在嚴謹訓練架構下督促其尋求感性的意涵，因而不致陷入經濟工具與名詞的浩瀚泥沼中，從而漸進體會出經濟學之精髓。
description.en:
The science of economics is characterized by logics and cautious reasoning-at which most of the students of natural science and technology are good at. It is also a fact that those who take better advantage of the right brain are very likely to be straightforward and thus seemingly more mechanical and unsympathetic. Economics can be seen as the mother of science under the condition that rational efficiency-as well as the socially humanity--are kept at the same time. As a matter of act, the economic trainings share the same goal as what is required by the General Education courses.
The first priority of the course is to highly motivate the students in the economic issues. We do our best to avoid too much weight generally put into teaching economics, leading to poor learning and teaching experience. Cases are studied in such a way that students will recognize the "real purpose of studying."  Real cases and examples are brought into discussion. We guide the students to"feel"the problems.

description.zh: 本課程是為非專業學生所設計的哲學概論，介紹西洋哲學的起源、西洋哲學的問題，以及哲學與人生的關係。哲學的問題意識起自人類的自覺，人類意圖認識自己，為宇宙人生尋求解答，哲學的發生本自人類天賦的求知欲，即其本性中對於智慧的追求與愛慕。這種愛慕智慧的精神是希臘文明留給西方世界的遺產，對於知識能持客觀批判的精神，對於真理能存認真熱切的態度，對於人生能有超克苦難的修持。在國際化的世代，我們對西方的認識應更深入其精神層面，此乃本課程規劃的初衷。

description.zh:
經濟學重視邏輯與嚴謹推理的理性特質是其主要特色，此亦為理工科系人之專長優勢，然而僅偏重左腦訓練的人才往往讓人覺得生冷機械，對事物看法也常過於直接而缺乏人情，若能在不失理性效率之下，兼顧以人為本之社會人文感性關懷，則經濟學自無愧為社會科學之母，其訓練目標亦與通識教育的人格均衡發展目的一致！
為避免陷入一般經濟教學因理論工具比重過高而失焦，導致學生學習興趣驟減以致成效不彰，本課程重點在於先讓學生擁有強烈之學習動機，接著認知到"確立學習目的"的重要性，藉由生活實例直接帶領學生面對並感受問題，從而引導出經濟學切入問題的思維方式，並傳授其正確可行的學習態度與方法，同時提醒學生維持對專業知識批判的精神，在嚴謹訓練架構下督促其尋求感性的意涵，因而不致陷入經濟工具與名詞的浩瀚泥沼中，從而漸進體會出經濟學之精髓。
description.en:
The science of economics is characterized by logics and cautious reasoning-at which most of the students of natural science and technology are good at. It is also a fact that those who take better advantage of the right brain are very likely to be straightforward and thus seemingly more mechanical and unsympathetic. Economics can be seen as the mother of science under the condition that rational efficiency-as well as the socially humanity--are kept at the same time. As a matter of act, the economic trainings share the same goal as what is required by the General Education courses.
The first priority of the course is to highly motivate the students in the economic issues. We do our best to avoid too much weight generally put into teaching economics, leading to poor learning and teaching experience. Cases are studied in such a way that students will recognize the "real purpose of studying."  Real cases and examples are brought into discussion. We guide the students to"feel"the problems.

description.zh: 此門課程主要在於瞭解社會學的意涵，並藉由跨領域的學習，讓不同學科能有對話的空間。課程涵蓋的範圍會兼顧理論與實用性，讓學生能思考當今的社會，理解到產生因素的多元性，並進而使個人眼界能更加開拓。期望學生於課程學習中能夠擁有更多對於整個社會的不同思維，以強化本身學科之所需，不但具有理論性深入的洞察力，也能引用到管理上實質的層面。
description.en: The purpose of this course is to understand sociology. It covers theory and practicability, and make students consider the current society, and understand the generated factors of diversity . Expect students' study can have more for the community as a whole different way of thinking, in order to strengthen their academic needs, not only has the theoretical depth of insight, but also on the substance applied to the management level.

description.zh: 本課程是為非專業學生所設計的哲學概論，介紹西洋哲學的起源、西洋哲學的問題，以及哲學與人生的關係。哲學的問題意識起自人類的自覺，人類意圖認識自己，為宇宙人生尋求解答，哲學的發生本自人類天賦的求知欲，即其本性中對於智慧的追求與愛慕。這種愛慕智慧的精神是希臘文明留給西方世界的遺產，對於知識能持客觀批判的精神，對於真理能存認真熱切的態度，對於人生能有超克苦難的修持。在國際化的世代，我們對西方的認識應更深入其精神層面，此乃本課程規劃的初衷。
description.en: This course is designed for student who is not disciplined in philosophy. As an introduction, we begin at the origin of western philosophy, the philosophical questions and finally, the relationship of human life and philosophy. Philosophy takes place when human being thinking of himself. Man by nature desire to know himself as well as the external world. And due to this love of wisdom, men can be critical to knowledge and be passionate toward truth. Eventually, grasping the sprit of western philosophy , we can view our life in quite a different view. In our time, facing the world of international, we should better understand the western culture, which is rooted in philosophy.

description.zh:
新創事業面臨許多的挑戰，包括：避�УP大企業競爭，找到存活的依據、從無到創立強勢品牌、創立或擴張自有市場/消費者據點等。本課程旨在啟發修課同學創業的興趣並協助修課同學思考新創事業如何平衡有限資源以迎向挑戰。
新創企業已發展成熟的企業是不一樣，主要是因為新創事業的資源有限，創業家必須同時兼顧許多面向並回應顧客所需。本課程旨在協助修課同學思考創建企業應注意的各種面向評估自己的創能力。
課程包含了三大部份，第一部份為創新與創業概念啟發；第二部份在辨別市場機會與發展市場；最後第三部份為新創事業行銷管理。行銷活動能夠將企業的產品及服務傳遞給顧客；並將產品、服務及企業本身的資訊帶到市場上；將顧客資訊回饋給企業。創業行銷管理能夠幫助創業者向潛在投資者及企業夥伴銷售創意以獲得資源，也讓創業家透過創新的商業手法來充分利用稀少的資源。
description.en:
Managers must have excellent leadership skills in order to A start-up company has lots of challenges, such as: niche market located and brand diffusion. The course intends to encourage the participant to become an entrepreneur and handle with these challenges. A start-up company is different from well-developed one due to limited resources. Usually, to response customer’s requirement, the entrepreneur must take multiple criteria into consideration simultaneously.
    The course includes three parts. Part I build students’ concept about innovation and entrepreneurship. Part II is about market identification. Part III is about marketing management of a start-up company. The efficient marketing activities enable business to approach customer’s requirement, to bring their customer product (or services) and get customer’s feedback. Also, the marketing management helps entrepreneur to reach their potential investor to obtain more resources.

description.zh: 透過一系列的資料採集、參考與互動，包含經驗分享、影片欣賞等，帶領修課同學探索創新（Innovation）、創業（Startup）以及最重要的 – 創業家創新精神（Entrepreneur Innovative Thinking）之本質。無論是工作上的創造，學習上的創造，或者是(創)事業上的創造，都必然需要一定程度的創新，才能在全球化競爭以及指數型科技（Exponential Technology）發展的趨勢下存活，最終獲得勝利、創造價值。
description.en: Through series of classes to train students embracing the innovative thinking and gradually internalize it to become innovative entrepreneurship. Since the generation is changing so rapidly, the competitors are no longer came from local land but from everywhere in global village. Under this highly competitive world, every one of us need to fully embrace the true value of innovation, and incubate our own entrepreneurship with hack spirit, which will lead us to an island of innovation.

description.zh: 透過一系列的資料採集、參考與互動，包含經驗分享、影片欣賞等，帶領修課同學探索創新（Innovation）、創業（Startup）以及最重要的 – 創業家創新精神（Entrepreneur Innovative Thinking）之本質。無論是工作上的創造，學習上的創造，或者是(創)事業上的創造，都必然需要一定程度的創新，才能在全球化競爭以及指數型科技（Exponential Technology）發展的趨勢下存活，最終獲得勝利、創造價值。

description.zh:
透過分析創新成功之實際個案，讓修課同學了解創新的本質。課程中將介紹不同類型的創新個案，包括：技術創新、產品創新、服務創新與管理創新。本課程也擬搭配邀請成功之創業顧問與談，提供實務經驗，分享創業者該有的認知以及創業的重要理念，當然也包括分享他們在邀創業過程中所面臨的各類挑戰。
創業是每個人都曾經懷抱過的夢想，透過創新成功之個案的分析，可以了解到個案公司是如何有步驟的循序漸進。針對每個個案，我們要求每位同學於課前完成個案的閱讀，並於上課前交出本次課程的課前預習心得。我們希望每位參與的同學都能在討論時充分表達意見，遇有不清楚或不同意見時能夠勇於提出他們的看法。本課程擬營造出一種研究的環境，讓學生可以針對個案盡其所能清楚的提出建議並來說服同儕。
description.en:
The course enable participant to realize the essential features of innovation via cases study. Various types of innovation cases are included, such as: technology innovation, service innovation and management innovation. We also plan to invites some successful constants to give participants talk and share their experiences, including the challenge and their resolving process.
The real case study enables participants to understand the entrepreneurship and the steps to start a business. The participants are required to complete the case reading and a preview report is required in advance the class. We hope that every participant can propose their opinion and persuade others colleges of their viewpoints.

description.zh: 以視覺藝術為探討重點，研究藝術起源以及原始美術、民俗與大眾藝術分野。探究式覺元素和設計原理以及應用媒材、使用技巧，涵蓋素描、水彩、油畫、版畫、混合媒材、雕塑、建築，廣告、包裝、服裝設計、工業產品設計及攝影等。配合幻燈教學，使同學對於視覺藝術有整體性、概括性的認識，以奠定將來從事藝術鑑賞和研究創造之基礎。
description.en: The focus of this course is the exploration of visual arts.  Students will study the origin of art and the distinction among primitive art, folk and popular art. This course also provides students with visual elements, design principles, applied media material, and techniques including charcoal drawing, water-colored painting, oil painting, graphic art, compound material, sculpture, architecture, advertisement, packaging, fashion design, industrial design, and photography. Slide teaching is adopted to give students a comprehensive and general understanding on visual art in order to foster students to appreciate, study, and create art.

description.zh: 「生活美學」是現代人依據東西方文化及各方美學的定義所推論出來的名詞，指應用於「生活」中食、衣、住、行、育、樂所體現美的內容及活動。依循相異的生活型態、社會環境，人類試圖重構生活藝術化與藝術生活化的當代美學。
description.en: “Aesthetics of living " will address the East-West cultural and aesthetic experience through series of questions that drive the discourse in contemporary life’s content and activities. Following the different lifestyles, social environment, human tries to reconstruct everyday life into contemporary aesthetics of living. This course aims to encourage students to think what is aesthetic of living, through the real life and spiritual life and concerned itself with the aesthetic problems in the lives of others.

description.zh: 音樂概論以透過此課程讓學生對音樂有總體認識，了解音樂的元素、技術理論及文化背景，同時在探索音樂美感構成上的標準，我們可以從探索不同歷史時期的人文思想背景，了解對於當時音樂創作理念與風格發展的影響，以及音樂審美觀念的發展演變之影響，立基於探索音樂的發展方向、藝術本質及審美意涵，對音樂藝術概念及美學思想之延伸探討。
description.en: Through this course—Introduction to Music, students would have a general understanding of music, understand the elements of music, technical theory and cultural background, at the same time in the music aesthetic to explore the composition of the standard, through exploring the different historical periods of humanistic background, to understand for the time that the idea of music composing and the impact of musical style development, as well as the development of music aesthetic concept of the evolution of the impact, based on discussing the development of music, the essence of art, and aesthetic meaning, to develop the concept of musical art, as well as a probe into the extension of aesthetic thought.

description.zh: 音樂概論以透過此課程讓學生對音樂有總體認識，了解音樂的元素、技術理論及文化背景，同時在探索音樂美感構成上的標準，我們可以從探索不同歷史時期的人文思想背景，了解對於當時音樂創作理念與風格發展的影響，以及音樂審美觀念的發展演變之影響，立基於探索音樂的發展方向、藝術本質及審美意涵，對音樂藝術概念及美學思想之延伸探討。
description.en: Through this course—Introduction to Music, students would have a general understanding of music, understand the elements of music, technical theory and cultural background, at the same time in the music aesthetic to explore the composition of the standard, through exploring the different historical periods of humanistic background, to understand for the time that the idea of music composing and the impact of musical style development, as well as the development of music aesthetic concept of the evolution of the impact, based on discussing the development of music, the essence of art, and aesthetic meaning, to develop the concept of musical art, as well as a probe into the extension of aesthetic thought.

description.zh: 以視覺藝術為探討重點，研究藝術起源以及原始美術、民俗與大眾藝術分野。探究式覺元素和設計原理以及應用媒材、使用技巧，涵蓋素描、水彩、油畫、版畫、混合媒材、雕塑、建築，廣告、包裝、服裝設計、工業產品設計及攝影等。配合幻燈教學，使同學對於視覺藝術有整體性、概括性的認識，以奠定將來從事藝術鑑賞和研究創造之基礎。
description.en: The focus of this course is the exploration of visual arts.  Students will study the origin of art and the distinction among primitive art, folk and popular art. This course also provides students with visual elements, design principles, applied media material, and techniques including charcoal drawing, water-colored painting, oil painting, graphic art, compound material, sculpture, architecture, advertisement, packaging, fashion design, industrial design, and photography. Slide teaching is adopted to give students a comprehensive and general understanding on visual art in order to foster students to appreciate, study, and create art.

description.zh: 以視覺藝術為探討重點，研究藝術起源以及原始美術、民俗與大眾藝術分野。探究式覺元素和設計原理以及應用媒材、使用技巧，涵蓋素描、水彩、油畫、版畫、混合媒材、雕塑、建築，廣告、包裝、服裝設計、工業產品設計及攝影等。配合幻燈教學，使同學對於視覺藝術有整體性、概括性的認識，以奠定將來從事藝術鑑賞和研究創造之基礎。
description.en: The focus of this course is the exploration of visual arts.  Students will study the origin of art and the distinction among primitive art, folk and popular art. This course also provides students with visual elements, design principles, applied media material, and techniques including charcoal drawing, water-colored painting, oil painting, graphic art, compound material, sculpture, architecture, advertisement, packaging, fashion design, industrial design, and photography. Slide teaching is adopted to give students a comprehensive and general understanding on visual art in order to foster students to appreciate, study, and create art.

description.zh: 「生活美學」是現代人依據東西方文化及各方美學的定義所推論出來的名詞，指應用於「生活」中食、衣、住、行、育、樂所體現美的內容及活動。依循相異的生活型態、社會環境，人類試圖重構生活藝術化與藝術生活化的當代美學。
description.en: “Aesthetics of living " will address the East-West cultural and aesthetic experience through series of questions that drive the discourse in contemporary life’s content and activities. Following the different lifestyles, social environment, human tries to reconstruct everyday life into contemporary aesthetics of living. This course aims to encourage students to think what is aesthetic of living, through the real life and spiritual life and concerned itself with the aesthetic problems in the lives of others.

description.zh: 「生活美學」是現代人依據東西方文化及各方美學的定義所推論出來的名詞，指應用於「生活」中食、衣、住、行、育、樂所體現美的內容及活動。依循相異的生活型態、社會環境，人類試圖重構生活藝術化與藝術生活化的當代美學。

Following the different lifestyles, social environment, human tries to reconstruct everyday life into contemporary aesthetics of living. This course aims to encourage students to think what is aesthetic of living, through the real life and spiritual life and concerned itself with the aesthetic problems in the lives of others.
